alert.note: Alert for Southampton; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 1:50PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Northampton, Southampton and southeastern Sussex Counties and the City of Franklin through 230 PM EDT... At 149 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Green Plain to 8 miles west of Newsoms to near Boykins. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Newsoms around 210 PM EDT. Courtland around 225 PM EDT. Franklin, Hunterdale and Sedley around 230 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Vicksville, Adams Grove, Gray, Grizzard, Handsom, Berlin, Yale, Lumberton, Manry and Worrell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.
